channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree concern outside property, 12th October
item.description:
I am writing to report a tree located on the pavement outside 7 Southbourne, BR2 7NJ. The tree urgently needs pruning and maintenance for several safety and maintenance reasons: • Its branches are now touching or very close to nearby electric cables, posing a potential hazard. • The roots are lifting and damaging the pavement, which could cause someone to trip or fall. • The amount of leaf fall from this tree is excessive, and it continuously covers my driveway. I am having to clear it regularly and fill my paid garden waste bin with this debris, leaving little room for my own garden waste. The exact tree opposite my neighbours’ house fell onto their car 2 years ago during a storm, both trees were the same size and positioned opposite each other. We can’t have an other accident happening on a car/ house or even worse on someone. Given these concerns, I would appreciate if the council could please inspect and arrange pruning as soon as possible. Many thanks Geraldine Garnier

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southbourne, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear sir madam I would like to bring this issue of antisocial behaviour and criminal activity to Hackney councils attention. Over the weekend a group of Irish travellers have moved, set up residency rent free in public mabley green park right next to the children's play area,football changing rooms. They have even brought with them their own roadwork fencing to cordon off a perimeter of land which belongs to Hackney Council.This is a public park for public people, residence to use. I am concerned because the travellers are driving their vehicles,vans onto the public mabley green park grass play area where children play. Irish travellers will be illegally parking, vehicles cloning,no tax, no insurance,no MOT,no permits, stealing vehicles, hiding vehicles identity, dumping unwanted vehicles on the land, shoplifting, fly tipping, benefit frauds, this is a common occurrence in the Hackney wick area with the large Irish communities. The caravan is also situated overlooking a children's play park. They are using large gas cylinders to cook which poses a health and safety fire concerned to building opposite and children's play area. If someone could be bothered at Hackney Council to investigate this matter., 12th October
item.description:
Dear sir madam I would like to bring this issue of antisocial behaviour and criminal activity to Hackney councils attention. Over the weekend a group of Irish travellers have moved, set up residency rent free in public mabley green park,ASB

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Conservancy Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree bocking day light, 12th October
item.description:
The tree on the corner of Fetching Rd and Fairfield Grove blocks the daylight of my house and the branches are dangerously hanging over my windows and can cause an accident for my children. The tree needs to be cut or trimmed on a regular basis. It makes a lot of rubbish.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfield Grove, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
